benchmark_details.name: Planetarium
benchmark_details.overview: Planetarium is a benchmark designed to evaluate language modelsâ€™ ability to generate PDDL code from natural language descriptions of planning tasks. It includes a dataset of 145,918 text-to-PDDL pairs and a novel PDDL equivalence algorithm for evaluating generated PDDL correctness.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate language models' performance in generating PDDL code from natural language descriptions of planning problems.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Currently only supports the Blocks World, Gripper, and Floor Tile domains.

data.source: Dataset based on the International Planning Competition (IPC), consisting of text descriptions paired with ground truth PDDL problems.
data.annotation: The dataset was procedurally generated by handcrafting templates for each task configuration.

methodology.calculation: Each output from language models is evaluated for syntactic parseability, solvability, and semantic correctness against the ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: The performance of models is assessed based on the percentage of generated PDDL that is valid, solvable, and semantically correct.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using a set of heldout configurations from the dataset.
